en.question: Which of the following polynomials is multilinear?

options.text: $g(X_1, X_2, X_3) = X_1 \cdot X_2 + X_2 \cdot X_3 + X_1 \cdot X_3$
$g(X_1, X_2, X_3) = X_1 \cdot X_2 \cdot X_2 + X_3$

en.feedback: Option B is multilinear â€” each variable appears at most to degree 1. Option A has $X_1 \cdot X_1 = X_1^2$. Option C expands to $X_1 \cdot X_2 - X_1^2 \cdot X_2$, containing $X_1^2$. Option D has $X_2 \cdot X_2 = X_2^2$. Remember: multilinear means each variable has degree at most 1!
